meanings.definition: The state or quality of being impermanent.
meanings.sent1: The impermanency of the sandcastle was evident as the waves washed it away.
meanings.sent2: We must accept the impermanency of life and cherish each moment.
meanings.sent3: The impermanency of the ice cream cone led to a race against time to finish it before it melted.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings captured the impermanency of youth, frozen in time on canvas.
meanings.sent5: The impermanency of the seasons changing reminds us of the beauty in transition.

meanings.definition: The condition of being temporary or fleeting.
meanings.sent1: The impermanency of the snowfall meant it would soon melt under the sun.
meanings.sent2: His impermanency in relationships made it hard for him to commit.
meanings.sent3: The impermanency of the butterfly's visit brought fleeting joy to the garden.
meanings.sent4: The impermanency of fame left her feeling empty despite her success.
meanings.sent5: The impermanency of childhood is a bittersweet reminder of growth and change.
